title: The World's Greatest Athlete
description:

The basic premise is that losing Coach Archer (John Amos) and his inept assistant Milo (Tim Conway) are about to be fired - and so they run away to the continent of Africa, where they find the WorldÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Greatest Athlete of the title, Nanu (Jan Michael-Vincent), whom they whisk back to America, where he turns the failing athletic program of the college into a success.  However, NanuÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s witch doctor godfather (played wonderfully by Roscoe Lee Browne) is unsure of Coach ArcherÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s intentions and follows to rescue Nanu, leading to a wonderfully hilarious scene where Tim Conway is shrunken down to one inch tall, and trying to warn Archer and Nanu.
ItÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s a very funny film, with the requisite romance between Nanu and the girl he meets and falls in love withÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½Jane.  I truly love the ending, when Coach Archer and Milo take another tripÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½to China.
